issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Eucalyptus should return the same error as AWS when a principle is incorrectly specified in a policy doc.
fields.summary: "MalformedPolicyDocument: Policy document should not specify a principal." Should Be Returned When Using Incorrect Access Policy File During IAM Role Creation

comments.body:
[~hspencer] OK I understand the issue now. The problem is not that it is returning the wrong error in 4.1 the problem is that it is not returning an error at all.
AWS output:
{code}
[mmunn:~/MY_FILES]aws iam put-role-policy --role-name describe-instances --policy-name  describe-instances --policy-document file://role-describe-instances-principle.json

A client error (MalformedPolicyDocument) occurred when calling the PutRolePolicy operation: Policy document should not specify a principal.
{code}

In 4.1 euare-roleuploadpolicy -r describe-instances -p describe-instances-policy -f role-describe-instances-principle.json 
does not return an error at all.

I will continue to investigate.

Code Review Request : EUCA-9959 "MalformedPolicyDocument: Policy document should not specify a principal." Should Be Returned When Using Incorrect Access Policy File During IAM Role Creation

branch : dev-mmunn1-EUCA-9959

diff :  git show --color 4600d25486bc149b2b074c7d1b010355b44b3eb5

Summary: For aws compatibility the error message "Policy document should not specify a principal." should be returned where the Principle
         element is not required. Currently it is a no-op and no error is thrown 
          

Solution: throw a JSONException in poilcies that include a Principle or NotPrinciple where they are not required.

Jenkins run : http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch/1287/

Unit test : described in comments, I have created a Eutester testcase for this issue at: /eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4-1/euca9959.py
[~mmunn1], the fix looks good. Not sure why we would put this in 4.1.1 as the fix seems more likely to cause issues than the bug (due to the behaviour change)
[~sjones] I agree Steve this will add behavior changes where errors that would not be thrown before will now. [~kedwards] Do we want to wait until 4.2 for this AWS compatibility issue to be included?
